intro: Synsepalum msolo, commonly known as the msolo fruit or African cherry, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The fruit is a small, round, yellowish drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. The plant is adapted to humid, tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit.
